amendment.description: Amendment sought to abolish the Overseas Private Investment Corporation (OPIC) by October 1, 1995, and transfer the remaining functions to the State Department.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 44 in the Congressional Record of June 20, 1995 to delete all funding for the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. The amendment would provide $1 million in funds to transfer the responsibility for long-term contracts to the Department of State.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Sanders amendment (A003) Failed by recorded vote: 90 - 329 (Roll no. 421).
